entries.title: New Report Highlights Concerning Trends For Cyberwarfare
entries.description: The Armis State of Cyberwarfare and Trends Report: 2022-2023 shares results from a global survey of more than 6,000 security professionals on awareness and preparedness for cyberwarfare, and provides a glimpse at where things are heading in the future.

entries.title: Backlash Or Marketing Savvy? M&Ms And The Perils Of Brands Playing The Culture Wars
entries.description: If Mars was trying to be inclusive with its latest M&M's campaign, why fold when faced with predictable insults from the usual suspects? The result is a lesson in ham-handed branding.

entries.title: Researchers Warn The EV Transition Needs Too Much Nasty Lithium.  That’s Not How Transitions Work
entries.description: Scientists working with UC Davis suggest that a conversion of today's cars to EVs with today's batteries means huge and destructive demand for lithium.  But the future rarely looks like today in technology.

entries.title: Let Us Not Bury Tech Too Fast...
entries.description: The FTX collapse, Meta’s swan dive, the Tesla meltdown, the Twitter fuss, the list goes on and on But at the same time, mind-bending advances in artificial intelligence and a series of related product announcements are about to unleash a wave of activity in the sector.

entries.title: Apple’s New MacBook Pro Has An Impressive Secret Feature

entries.title: Taser-Drone Developer Axon Faces Newly Published Criticism From Ethics Advisors
entries.description: Nine resigned members of Axon’s ethics board have detailed their reasoning for opposing the company’s controversial Taser-drone project last year.

entries.title: Trust Your Gut To TikTok? Not So Fast Warn Experts

entries.title: UV Nail Polish Dryers May Cause Skin Cancer
entries.description: A new study from the University of California San Diego has found that UV-emitting nail polish dryers used to cure the chemicals used in gel manicures may cause cancer.

entries.title: The Threat Of “Default” Tech
entries.description: The lack of preparedness by organizations to create response plans has made endpoint devices and users the first point of attack and compromise for most cyberattacks.

entries.title: This Experiment Shows What Inspires Awe And How That Makes You Feel Better

entries.title: Ginkgo Bioworks Fires Up Its Bio Foundry To Take On The Billion-Dollar Enzyme Market
entries.description: Enzymes are a multi-billion dollar market and growing. But engineering enzymes is not an easy task. Ginkgo Bioworks, Inc. has just launched its end-to-end enzyme service to help companies outsource their enzyme R&D efforts.

entries.title: More Americans Delaying Healthcare Because Of Cost, New Survey Shows
entries.description: New research from Gallup shows that more Americans than ever are delaying healthcare due to costs. Rates of delaying care differ based on gender, age, and income.

entries.title: The Market Power Of Technology: An Explanation Of The Economic Impact Of Technology

Yet as founding CEO of FreeWorld, Wang gets the formerly incarcerated into high-wage trucking jobs, breaking the cycle of poverty and recidivism.
